intro: Tithymalus thyrsoideus, commonly known as the clustered tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
